trans-unit.source: Represents an item in a list or outline.
A ListItemStructure can only be a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure"></xref> class.
Adds a block to a list item.
The block to add.
The element is .
Gets or sets the name of the numeral, character, or bullet symbol for the list item as it appears in the formatting markup of the document.

A <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure> mirrors a set of items, usually short paragraphs, that are actually formatted as a list in the `<FixedPage>` part of a document's markup.
Typically, each item in the list is formatted with a marker such as a numeral, character, or bullet.
The marker could also be multiple characters or even an image.
The value of the Marker property is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> attribute of the element, in the `<FixedPage>` part of a document's markup, that specifies what that marker is.

For example, if the marker element specifies the numeral 3 as the marker for a list item and the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> of that element is 'ThirdItem', then the Marker property of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> that mirrors the list item should be set to 'ThirdItem.'

If a list item has a marker, failing to reference the marker with the Marker property of the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> may force applications that are consuming the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> to display or print the marker at the end of the document.
A <xref:System.String> marking list item.
To be added.
This method has not been implemented.
Always raises <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Adds a child object to the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure>.

Typically, a child of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListItemStructure> is a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ParagraphStructure>, but it can be a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.FigureStructure>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.TableStructure>, or a (nested) <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.ListStructure>.
The child <xref:System.Object> that is added.
value is not one of the types that can be a child of this class.
See **Remarks**.
Not implemented.
Not used.
